title: Make InitCommand idempotent - only create starter task if tasks.jsonl is empty
description: In app/Commands/InitCommand.php, wrap the starter task creation (lines 38-44) in a check: if ($taskService->all()->isEmpty()). This prevents duplicate starter tasks when running init on an already-initialized project.
consumed_output:
Task completed.

## Summary

1. Updated `InitCommand.php` to check if `tasks.jsonl` is empty before creating a starter task, wrapping lines 38-44 in `if ($taskService->all()->isEmpty())`.
2. Added a test to verify idempotency: running `init` twice does not create duplicate starter tasks.
3. All tests pass (including the new idempotency test).
4. Code formatted with Pint.
5. Committed changes: `44c389f`.
6. Marked task `f-9c1dac` as done with the commit hash.

The `init` command is now idempotent: it only creates a starter task when `tasks.jsonl` is empty, preventing duplicates when run multiple times on an already-initialized project.
